018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
021import static java.lang.String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER;
022import static java.util.Comparator.naturalOrder;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025
026import java.util.Comparator;
027
028import org.apiguardian.api.API;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.KeyBasedComparator;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.ListBasedComparator;
035import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.StringBasedComparator;
036
037/**
038 *  This class provides factory methods for a bunch of different
039 *  implementations of
040 *  {@link Comparator}.
041 *
042 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
043 *  @version $Id: Comparators.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $
044 *  @since 0.0.5
045 *
046 *  @UMLGraph.link
047 */
048@UtilityClass
049@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Comparators.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $" )
050@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
051public final class Comparators
052{
053        /*---------------*\
054    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
055        \*---------------*/
056    /**
057     *  <p>{@summary Implementations of this interface provides the sort order
058     *  key from the given instance of the type.}</p>
059     *  <p>Usually the implementation of
060     *  {@link #getKey(Object) getKey()}
061     *  must ensure that the returned keys are distinct for distinct arguments.
062     *  This means for the arguments {@code a1} and {@code a2}, and the
063     *  generated keys <code>k<sub>a1</sub></code> and
064     *  <code>k<sub>a2</sub></code> that the following must be both
065     *  {@code true}:</p>
066     *  <ul>
067     *      <li><code>a1&nbsp;=&nbsp;a2&nbsp;&#x21d4;&nbsp;k<sub>a1</sub>&nbsp;=&nbsp;k<sub>a2</sub></code></li>
068     *      <li><code>a1&nbsp;&#x2260;&nbsp;a2&nbsp;&#x21d4;&nbsp;k<sub>a1</sub>&nbsp;&#x2260;&nbsp;k<sub>a2</sub></code></li>
069     *  </ul>
070     *  <p>This also requires that {@code getKey()} for the same argument must
071     *  provide always the same key.</p>
072     *
073     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
074     *  @version $Id: Comparators.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $
075     *  @since 0.0.5
076     *
077     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
078     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
079     *      be the same as the type itself.
080     *
081     *  @UMLGraph.link
082     */
083    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
084    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Comparators.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $" )
085    @FunctionalInterface
086    public interface KeyProvider<T,K>
087    {
088            /*---------*\
089        ====** Methods **======================================================
090            \*---------*/
091        /**
092         *  Returns the sort order key for the given instance.
093         *
094         *  @param  instance    The instance; may be {@code null}.
095         *  @return The respective sort order key; will be {@code null} if
096         *      the {@code instance} was {@code null}.
097         */
098        public K getKey( T instance );
099    }
100    //  interface KeyProvider
101
102        /*--------------*\
103    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
104        \*--------------*/
105    /**
106     *  No instance allowed for this class.
107     */
108    private Comparators() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Comparators.class ); }
109
110        /*---------*\
111    ====** Methods **==========================================================
112        \*---------*/
113    /**
114     *  Returns a comparator that compares Strings ignoring the case.<br>
115     *  <br>Internally this is
116     *  {@link String#CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER},
117     *  with the limitations described there.
118     *
119     *  @return The comparator.
120     */
121    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
122    public static final Comparator<String> caseInsensitiveComparator() { return CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER; }
123
124    /**
125     *  Returns a dummy comparator for elements that implements
126     *  {@link Comparable}.
127     *  Use this comparator if a
128     *  {@link Comparator}
129     *  is required for some reason, but your objects can be compared already
130     *  directly by their inherent
131     *  {@link Comparable#compareTo(Object)}
132     *  method.<br>
133     *  <br>A
134     *  {@link NullPointerException}
135     *  (and not a
136     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException})
137     *  is thrown, if the first argument is {@code null}. Whether an exception
138     *  is thrown when the second argument is {@code null} depends on the
139     *  implementation of
140     *  {@link Comparable#compareTo(Object) T.compareTo(Object)}.
141     *
142     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
143     *  @return The comparator.
144     *
145     *  @see Comparator#naturalOrder()
146     *
147     *  @deprecated Use
148     *      {@link Comparator#naturalOrder()}
149     *      instead.
150     */
151    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
152    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
153    public static final <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparableComparator()
154    {
155        final Comparator<T> retValue = naturalOrder();
156
157        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
158        return retValue;
159    }   //  comparableComparator()
160
161    /**
162     *  Returns a comparator that generates a sort key from the elements before
163     *  sorting them.<br>
164     *  <br>The implementation of this comparator generates the sort keys for
165     *  each and every comparison. This is obviously not very efficient. A more
166     *  efficient implementation is provided by
167     *  {@link #keyBasedComparator(KeyProvider, Comparator, boolean)}
168     *
169     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
170     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
171     *      be the same as the type itself.
172     *  @param  keyProvider The method that generates the sort key.
173     *  @return The comparator.
174     *
175     *  @note The key provider must return {@code null} for a {@code null}
176     *      value, as described for
177     *      {@link KeyProvider#getKey(Object)}.
178     *
179     *  @see KeyProvider
180     */
181    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
182    public static final <T, K extends Comparable<K>> Comparator<T> keyBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<? super T, K> keyProvider )
183    {
184        requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
185        final var retValue = (Comparator<T>) ( o1, o2) -> signum( keyProvider.getKey( o1 ).compareTo( keyProvider.getKey( o2 ) ) );
186
187        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
188        return retValue;
189    }   //  keyBasedComparator()
190
191    /**
192     *  A comparator that generates a sort key from the elements before sorting
193     *  them.<br>
194     *  <br>As it is not very efficient to generate the sort keys for each and
195     *  every comparison, it is possible to cache them.
196     *
197     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
198     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
199     *      be the same as the type itself.
200     *  @param  keyProvider The method that generates the sort key.
201     *  @param  keyComparator   The comparator that determines the order for
202     *      the keys.
203     *  @param  cacheKeys   A flag that determines whether the keys are to be
204     *      cached internally; {@code true} means they are kept, {@code false}
205     *      means that the keys are generated newly for each comparison.
206     *  @return The comparator.
207     *
208     *  @note The key provider must return {@code null} for a {@code null}
209     *      value, as described for
210     *      {@link KeyProvider#getKey(Object)}.
211     *  @note The internally used cache will be kept for later uses of the
212     *      comparator; this means that the key provider may not change its
213     *      behaviour meanwhile.
214     *  @note The internal cache is based on an
215     *      {@link java.util.IdentityHashMap IdentityHashMap}
216     *      with instances of the argument type <code>&lt;T&gt;</code> as the
217     *      key. If the key generation through the key provider will provide
218     *      equal keys for non-identical, but otherwise equal arguments, the
219     *      cache may not be efficient.
220     *
221     *  @see KeyProvider
222     */
223    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
224    public static final <T, K> Comparator<T> keyBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<K> keyComparator, final boolean cacheKeys )
225    {
226        return new KeyBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, keyComparator, cacheKeys );
227    }   //  keyBasedComparator()
228
229    /**
230     *  <p>{@summary Returns a comparator that works on a list of sort
231     *  keys.}</p>
232     *  <p>Sometimes, a special sort order is required that cannot be defined
233     *  as a rule based on the values themselves. Instead an ordered list of
234     *  values defines their sequence.</p>
235     *  <p>This method creates a new
236     *  {@link Comparator}
237     *  instance that works on the given list of values. Values that are not on
238     *  that list will be placed to the end, ordered according to their natural
239     *  order.</p>
240     *
241     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
242     *  @param  values  The values in their order.
243     *  @return The comparator.
244     */
245    @SafeVarargs
246    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
247    public static final <T extends Comparable<T>> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final T... values )
248    {
249        final var retValue = new ListBasedComparator<T,T>( t -> t, naturalOrder(), requireNonNullArgument( values, "values" ).clone() );
250
251        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
252        return retValue;
253    }   //  listBasedComparator()
254
255    /**
256     *  <p>{@summary A comparator that works on a list of sort keys.}</p>
257     *  <p>Sometimes, a special sort order is required that cannot be defined
258     *  as a rule based on the values themselves. Instead an ordered list of
259     *  keys defines their sequence.</p>
260     *  <p>The implementation first determines the key for a given value, then
261     *  it looks up that key in the key list to determine the sort order.
262     *  Values whose keys are not in the key list are ordered based on the
263     *  natural sort order of the keys.
264     *
265     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
266     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
267     *      be the same as the type itself.
268     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
269     *      {@link Comparators.KeyProvider}
270     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
271     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
272     *  @return The comparator.
273     */
274    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
275    @SafeVarargs
276    public static final <T,K extends Comparable<K>> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final K... keys )
277    {
278        final var retValue = new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, naturalOrder(), requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ).clone() );
279
280        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
281        return retValue;
282    }   //  listBasedComparator()
283
284    /**
285     *  <p>{@summary A comparator that works on a list of sort keys.}</p>
286     *  <p>Sometimes, a special sort order is required that cannot be defined
287     *  as a rule based on the values themselves. Instead an ordered list of
288     *  keys defines their sequence.</p>
289     *  <p>The implementation first determines the key for a given value, then
290     *  it looks up that key in the key list to determine the sort order.
291     *  Values whose keys are not in the key list are ordered based on the
292     *  order of their keys that is implied by the given comparator.
293     *
294     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
295     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
296     *      be the same as the type itself.
297     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
298     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
299     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
300     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
301     *      that are not listed.
302     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
303     *  @return The comparator.
304     */
305    @SafeVarargs
306    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
307    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super K> comparator, final K... keys )
308    {
309        final var retValue = new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, comparator, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ).clone() );
310
311        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
312        return retValue;
313    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
314
315    /**
316     *  A comparator for numeric values.
317     *
318     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
319     *  @return The comparator.
320     *
321     *  @since 0.1.0
322     */
323    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
324    public static final <T extends Number> Comparator<T> numberComparator()
325    {
326        final var retValue = (Comparator<T>) ( v1, v2) ->
327        {
328            //noinspection rawtypes
329            if( v1 instanceof final Comparable comparable )
330            {
331                @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
332                final var result = signum( comparable.compareTo( v2 ) );
333                return result;
334            }
335            //noinspection NumericCastThatLosesPrecision
336            return (int) Math.signum( v1.doubleValue() - v2.doubleValue() );
337        };
338
339        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
340        return retValue;
341    }   //  numberComparator()
342
343    /**
344     *  A comparator that compares arbitrary object types based on their String
345     *  representations.
346     *
347     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
348     *  @param  stringConverter The instance of
349     *      {@link StringConverter}
350     *      that is used to get the String representation of the instances to
351     *      compare.
352     *  @return The comparator.
353     *
354     *  @since 0.1.0
355     */
356    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
357    public static final <T> Comparator<T> stringBasedComparator( final StringConverter<T> stringConverter )
358    {
359        final var retValue = new StringBasedComparator<>( stringConverter );
360
361        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
362        return retValue;
363    }   //  stringBasedComparator()
364}
365//  class Comparators
366
